title: The Echo of Silence

protagonist.name: Kaelen Thorne
protagonist.signature: Obsessive note-taking, gentle touch with artifacts
protagonist.flaw: Prefers the dead to the living

setting: An abandoned Dyson sphere, overgrown with biomechanical flora.
theme: The cost of knowing the truth.
glitch_concept: The flora hums a frequency that rewrites short-term memory.

characters.name: Kaelen Thorne
characters.description: Xeno-archaeologist. Obsessive note-taking, gentle touch with artifacts. Prefers the dead to the living.

characters.name: Overseer Merrick Vane
characters.description: A high-ranking liquidator for the Stellar Consortium. Vane believes the Dyson sphere's history is a liability that must be scrapped for parts. Heavily augmented with military-grade cybernetics, he views Kaelen's archaeology as a waste of time and a threat to corporate secrets.

characters.name: Unit 734 'Echo'
characters.description: A fractal maintenance drone half-consumed by the sphere's metal-eating orchids. Echo communicates through light patterns and corrupted audio logs from the sphere's original inhabitants. It acts as Kaelen's guide, though its logic is often driven by the plants growing inside its chassis.

characters.name: Dr. Elara Vance
characters.description: A brilliant but erratic scientist fascinated by the sphere's synthetic ecosystem. Unlike Kaelen, she cares little for the past, seeing the sphere as a crucible for future evolution. She is willing to destroy priceless artifacts if it means harvesting a rare spore or viable enzyme, putting her constantly at odds with Kaelen.

characters.name: Jax 'Rustbucket' Pendergast
characters.description: A grimy, erratic survivor who has dwelt in the sphere's ventilation shafts for decades, surviving on filtered algae paste and sheer luck. Wearing a patchwork suit of mismatched pressure seals and cured bio-leather, Jax knows the sphere's geography better than anyone. He acts as a fence, trading ancient data chips to Kaelen while selling scrap coordinates to Overseer Vane, dangerously playing both sides to fund his escape. He is deeply paranoid about the 'Singing Moss' and constantly hums discordant tunes to drown out voices only he can hear.

characters.name: Torren 'Grave' Blackwood
characters.description: A towering, heavily scarred mercenary originally hired by Overseer Vane to ensure the safety of the liquidation team. Torren is unique because he has developed a superstitious reverence for the sphere's 'haunted' atmosphere, contrary to his orders to sanitize it. He has taken a vow of silence regarding a past military tragedy, speaking only when absolutely necessary in a tectonic rumble. Secretly, he creates intricate charcoal sketches of the biomechanical flora during his watch shifts, hiding them in his ammo pouches. His central conflict lies in his contract: he is sworn to protect the corporate interests that intend to incinerate the very beauty he has come to worship, often leading him to 'accidentally' misinterpret orders that would harm the ecosystem.
